Comments: Surprisingly, yes they are in the process of employing KPIs to do just that. As seen under Key Performance Indicators "As part of the Audit Process referred to above, we will employ primary KPIs, remedial actions, timescales and steps for completion, for the following: The outcomes of internal and external compliance audits we undertake, including all legal obligations. The ongoing monitoring of payroll systems for warning indicators. Inconsistencies within normal day to day staffing of operations, and potential Staff welfare issues These will be constantly reviewed and modified where appropriate for inclusion in future versions of this statement" George Crook-Smith[https://wikirate.org/George_Crook_Smith].....2017-10-18 12:02:03 UTC

Metric: Business & Human Rights Resource Centre+MSA homepage link (archived)
Comments: The home page clearly has a CSR tab where the views on modern slavery are clearly stated. George Crook-Smith[https://wikirate.org/George_Crook_Smith].....2017-10-18 11:32:23 UTC

Areas of highest risk are those involving manual, unskilled, repetitive activities and have not been identified as intrinsically geographical. Corey Price[https://wikirate.org/Corey_Price].....2017-10-23 13:24:21 UTC

" Any undesirable issues discovered within our Contractor base will be immediately highlighted to the GLAA. Any issues involving people will be notified to the appropriate authorities. " Clearly states that it will report to the appropriate authorities should something arise. Under principal risks. George Crook-Smith[https://wikirate.org/George_Crook_Smith].....2017-10-18 11:54:48 UTC

Under Key Performance Indicators "The outcomes of internal and external compliance audits we undertake, including all legal obligations. Walk Free+MSA policy applicable to tier 1 (binary)

Value: Suppliers comply with laws and company’s policies (direct / tier 1), Prohibit use of forced labour (direct / tier 1), Contracts include clauses on forced labour (direct / tier 1)
Comments: Many sections detail it, "Commitments to Anti-Modern Slavery" is full of things they do to stop it. An example: "We have reviewed and updated Employment Contracts for our Employees, Recruitment and Induction Policies along with other Policies and Procedures which make clear that any form of Modern Slavery – including coercion, trafficking, payment for work-finding, and other related exploitation – is not permitted, and totally unacceptable within our Business." George Crook-Smith[https://wikirate.org/George_Crook_Smith].....2017-10-18 11:39:18 UTC

Under Principal Risks "High risk activities will be monitored and reviewed on a regular basis. Any undesirable issues discovered within our Contractor base will be immediately highlighted to the GLAA." George Crook-Smith[https://wikirate.org/George_Crook_Smith].....2017-10-18 11:48:05 UTC No specific processes are disclosed that would try to identify where risks in the supply chain reside. It is more about assessing and monitoring the risks once they have already been identified. Laureen van Breen[https://wikirate.org/Laureen_van_Breen].....2019-08-09 11:14:53 UTC

Comments: Misread, there is a citation under our organisation. 'working in conjunction with Contract Growers, Contractors and Labour Agencies (our Supply Chain Partners).' George Crook-Smith[https://wikirate.org/George_Crook_Smith].....2017-10-18 11:51:50 UTC Our Organisation comprises a Group of Companies operating thought the United Kingdom, involved in each stage of the production of eggs, chicks and chicken, turkey, working in conjunction with Contract Growers, Contractors and Labour Agencies (our Supply Chain Partners). Metric: Walk Free+MSA supply chain due diligence

Comments: Under Modern Slavery Training "We will continue to provide our Employees, Managers, Directors and Supply Chain Partners with the necessary tools and training, as well as support, guidance and information based on current advice from the GLAA to equip them with the skills required to identify and prevent Modern Slavery and Human Trafficking. Relevant staff undertake agency audit tool, Stronger Together and ETI training courses." George Crook-Smith[https://wikirate.org/George_Crook_Smith].....2017-10-18 11:59:17 UTC

Value: Whistleblower protection (direct employees), Whistleblower protection (supply chain workers)
Comments: Although there is a section under whistleblowing that clearly states. "We encourage consistently an open culture in all our dealings between Employees and people with whom we come into contact. Effective and honest communication is essential if malpractice and wrongdoing are to be dealt with effectively." And "Our Whistleblowing Policy sets out guidelines for individuals who feel they need to raise certain issues in confidence, which could include forced labour concerns. " The location of this policy is unclear so at the moment it is unknown what kind of protection that they have. George Crook-Smith[https://wikirate.org/George_Crook_Smith].....2017-10-18 11:58:31 UTC We provide an independent confidential channel of communication for whistleblowing. This Policy applies to all individuals working at all levels within the Organisation, including Senior Managers, Officers, Directors, Employees, Consultants, Contractors, Trainees, Homeworkers, Part-Time and Fixed-Term Workers, Suppliers, Casual and Agency Staf...

Our Whistleblowing Policy sets out guidelines for individuals who feel they need to raise certain issues in confidence, which could include forced labour concerns. We provide an independent confidential channel of communication for whistleblowing.2 Francisca S[https://wikirate.org/Francisca_S].....2021-04-29 18:10:36 UTC
